description.en:
The course introduces theoretical and methodological aspects of spatial mobility and its relation to information and communication technologies (ICTs). Lectures and seminars concentrate on mobility studies and mobile data used in geography, tourism and urban studies. Ethical issues in the use of ICT-based big data and differences arising from culture and context are addressed.

The course consists of 7 lectures (2x45 min), 2 practical sessions (2x45 min), five assignments and 5 seminars. Each lecture and seminar has an additional text or slide material available in the Moodle.
description.et:
Kursuse raames tutvustatakse ruumilise mobiilsuse käsitlemise teoreetilisi ja metodoloogilisi aspekte ning selle seoseid info- ja kommunikatsioonitehnoloogia kasutusega. Vaadeldakse positsioneerimise uuringute ja asukohapõhiste teenuste rakendusi linnaplaneerimises, äris ja turismiuuringutes. Käsitletakse IKT-põhiste suurandmete kasutamise eetilisi küsimusi ning kultuurilist ja kontekstist tulenevaid erisusi.

Kursus koosneb 7 loengust (2x45 min), 2 praktikumist, 5 seminaritööst ja 5 seminarist. Iga loengu ja seminari kohta on Moodle'i keskkonda lisatud täiendav teksti- või slaidimaterjal.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce the theoretical and methodological aspects of spatial mobility, information society and Smart City. Special focus is on mobile telephone and ICT-based research methods and applications used in urban planning. Ethical issues in the use of ICT-based big data and differences arising from culture and context are addressed.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärgiks on tutvustada inimeste ruumilise mobiilsuse, infoühiskonna ja targa linna kaasaegseid teemasid ja uurimismeetodeid. Erilist tähelepanu pööratakse mobiiltelefonidel ja teistel IKT allikatel põhinevatele uurimismeetoditele ja rakendustele linnaplaneerimises. Käsitletakse IKT-põhiste suurandmete kasutamise eetilisi küsimusi ning kultuurilist ja kontekstist tulenevaid erisusi.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course the student
- understands terminology and concepts of spatial mobility;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb ruumilise mobiilsuse käsitlemise mõisteid ja kontseptsioone;

learning_outcomes.en: - is aware how spatial mobility, social mobility and activities of individuals are interrelated;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab, kuidas on seotud ruumiline mobiilsus, inimeste tegevused ja sotsiaalne mobiilsus;

learning_outcomes.en: - is aware of the impacts of information and communication technologies (ICT) on spatial mobility;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab, kuidas info- ja kommunikatsioonitehnoloogia mõjutab ruumilist mobiilsust;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the data collection methods of spatial mobility;
- has an overview of passive mobile positioning data;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb passiivse mobiilpositsioneerimise andmeid ja teab kuidas neid kasutatakse;

learning_outcomes.en: - has an overview of active positioning methods and smartphone based data;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb nutitelefonipõhiseid aktiivse mobiilpositsioneerimise meetodeid ja teab kuidas neid kasutatakse;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to measure individuals' spatial mobility with mobile positioning;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab mobiilpositsioneerimise andmete abil inimeste ruumilist mobiilsust mõõta;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to critically analyse the data and highlight the shortcomings of its use;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab andmeid kriitiliselt analüüsida ja tuua esile nendes esinevaid puudujääke;

learning_outcomes.en: - understands the concepts of information society and Smart City;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb infoühiskonna ja targa linna kontseptsioone;

learning_outcomes.en: - has an overview of social media data and research applications;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb sotsiaalmeedia andmeid ja nende kasutamise meetodeid;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to use mobile phone and social media based information sources for urban studies and planning;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kasutada IKT põhiseid infoallikaid linnaruumi iseloomustamisel ja linnaplaneerimisel;

learning_outcomes.en: - is aware of the ethical issues related to the use of big data;
learning_outcomes.et: - on teadlik IKT-põhiste suurandmete kasutamisega seotud eetilistest probleemidest;

learning_outcomes.en: - understands how culture and context affect the availability and use of data;
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab, kuidas kultuur ja kontekst mõjutavad andmete kättesaadavust ja kasutust;

learning_outcomes.en: - has an overview of international initiatives in the use of big data;
learning_outcomes.et: - omab ülevaadet rahvusvahelistest initsiatiividest suurandmete kasutamisel;

learning_outcomes.en: - has the ability to work in a group and clearly present the results of the assignments.
learning_outcomes.et: - omab oskust töötada rühmas ja teostatud tööde tulemusi arusaadavalt esitada.

description.et:
1) The first part (70%) of the grade is formed based on assignments.
Five assignments together enable student to have a deeper understanding and overview of different ICT-based datasets and related terminology.

2) The second part (30%) is constituted by the final test.
The student is evaluated based on the knowledge and ability to discuss the topics covered in lectures and seminars. These topics are important for understanding and planning contemporary society.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Introduction to course plan.
Lecture I: 1) Geography of information society, 2) Spatial mobility, social mobility, activities and travel.
Introducing assignment I: "Personal experience with mobility".

Lecture II: 1) ICT and society, 2) Spatial mobility and information and communication technologies (ICT), 3) Methods for collecting movement data, 4) Collecting movement data with mobile phones - passive and active mobile positioning.

Lecture III: Ethics and cultural differences in the use of ICT-based data.
Introducing assignment II: "Analyzing spatial mobility with CDR data".
Practical session I: Helping with assignment II "Analyzing spatial mobility with CDR data".

Seminar I: Presenting assignment II "Analyzing spatial mobility with CDR data".
Introducing assignment III: "Active mobile positioning and data collection with Smartphone".
Practical session II: Helping with assignment III "Active mobile positioning and data collection with Smartphone".
Seminar II: Presenting assignment III "Active mobile positioning and data collection with Smartphone".

Lecture IV: Mobile positioning data in urban studies and transportation.
Introducing assignment IV: "Business plan exercise".
Lecture V: Sensors for measuring the environment and movements (Mihkel Tedremaa, Superhands).
Lecture VI: Big data and initiatives with mobile phones (Erki Saluveer, Positium).
Seminar III: Presenting assignment IV "Business plan exercise".

Lecture VII: Information society (prof. M. Zook).
Introducing assignment V: "Information society".
Lecture VIII: Information society and social media I (prof. M. Zook).
Lecture IX: Information society and social media II (prof. M. Zook)
Seminar IV: Presenting assignment V "Information society" (prof. M. Zook)
